short_description: Amazon EC2 provides scalable computing capacity in the AWS cloud. It allows you to launch virtual servers as needed and manage them easily. You can choose from a variety of instance types optimized for different use cases, such as compute-optimized, memory-optimized, or storage-optimized workloads. EC2 is foundational to cloud computing with AWS.

ASG helps maintain application availability by automatically adding or removing EC2 instances according to conditions you define. It is ideal for ensuring your applications scale dynamically with demand, helping you optimize costs and performance simultaneously.

AWS Lambda lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers. You simply upload your code, and Lambda takes care of everything required to run and scale it. It automatically handles the compute fleet offering a highly available and fault-tolerant service that seamlessly scales with the size of your workload.

Elastic Beanstalk is an easy-to-use service for deploying and scaling web applications and services. You upload your code, and it automatically handles deployment, from capacity provisioning to load balancing. It supports multiple languages and frameworks such as Java, .NET, PHP, Node.js, Python, Ruby, Go, and Docker.

Amazon API Gateway enables you to create, publish, maintain, monitor, and secure APIs at any scale. It acts as a 'front door' for applications to access data, business logic, or functionality from your backend services securely and efficiently.

Amazon SNS is a fully managed pub/sub messaging service that enables decoupling microservices, distributed systems, and serverless applications. It supports message filtering and message fan-out to multiple endpoints, including Lambda, SQS, HTTP/S, and email.

Amazon SQS is a fully managed message queuing service that enables decoupling and scaling microservices, distributed systems, and serverless applications. It supports standard and FIFO queues for handling high-throughput and order-sensitive tasks respectively.

Amazon EventBridge is a serverless event bus that makes it easy to connect applications using data from your own apps, integrated SaaS apps, and AWS services. It simplifies event-driven architecture and can route data to Lambda, Step Functions, and more.

Amazon RDS makes it easier to set up, operate, and scale a relational database in the cloud. It provides cost-efficient and resizable capacity while automating time-consuming administration tasks. RDS supports multiple database engines including PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB, Oracle, and SQL Server.

Amazon DynamoDB is a key-value and document database that delivers single-digit millisecond performance at any scale. It is fully managed, serverless, and designed for high availability and durability, supporting multi-region replication.

Amazon Redshift is a fully managed, petabyte-scale data warehouse service in the cloud. It enables fast query performance using SQL-based tools. Redshift uses columnar storage and parallel query execution to efficiently analyze large volumes of data.

Amazon Neptune is a fully managed graph database service optimized for storing and querying highly connected data. It supports popular graph models such as RDF and property graphs, and is used for recommendation engines, fraud detection, and knowledge graphs.

Amazon S3 is an object storage service that offers industry-leading scalability, data availability, security, and performance. It is designed to store and retrieve any amount of data from anywhere on the web, ideal for backup, archive, big data analytics, and more.

Amazon EBS provides block-level storage volumes for use with EC2 instances. It is ideal for workloads that require persistent storage. EBS volumes behave like raw, unformatted block devices, and can be used to store data that requires frequent updates.

Amazon EFS provides scalable file storage for use with AWS Cloud services and on-premises resources. Itâ€™s a fully managed NFS file system. It is built to scale on demand to petabytes without disrupting applications, growing and shrinking automatically as files are added and removed.

Amazon VPC lets you provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud where you can launch AWS resources in a virtual network that you define. You control your virtual networking environment, including IP address ranges, subnets, route tables, and network gateways.

Amazon Route 53 is a scalable and highly available Domain Name System (DNS) web service. It connects user requests to infrastructure running in AWS. It offers domain registration, DNS routing, and health checking, helping with global traffic management and availability.

AWS IAM enables you to manage access to AWS services and resources securely. You can create and manage AWS users and groups and use permissions to allow and deny their access. IAM also supports multi-factor authentication (MFA) and policy-based controls for fine-grained access.

Amazon Cognito lets you add user sign-up, sign-in, and access control to your web and mobile apps quickly and easily. It supports identity federation, allowing users to authenticate through social identity providers or SAML-based providers.

Amazon CloudWatch monitors your AWS resources and applications in real time. It collects and tracks metrics, logs, and events. You can use CloudWatch to detect anomalous behavior, set alarms, and automate responses to keep your systems running smoothly.

AWS X-Ray helps developers analyze and debug production and distributed applications, such as those built using microservices architecture. It provides request tracing and performance bottleneck identification by visualizing service maps and request flows.

AWS Lambda lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers. You simply upload your code, and Lambda takes care of everything required to run and scale it. It automatically handles the compute fleet offering a highly available and fault-tolerant service that seamlessly scales with the size of your workload.

Amazon API Gateway enables you to create, publish, maintain, monitor, and secure APIs at any scale. It acts as a 'front door' for applications to access data, business logic, or functionality from your backend services securely and efficiently.

Amazon Athena is an interactive query service that makes it easy to analyze data in Amazon S3 using standard SQL. Athena is serverless, so there is no infrastructure to manage, and you pay only for the queries you run.

Amazon Kinesis makes it easy to collect, process, and analyze real-time, streaming data. You can build custom, real-time applications. Kinesis supports streaming video, audio, application logs, website clickstreams, IoT telemetry data, and more.

AWS CodePipeline automates the build, test, and deploy phases of your release process every time there is a code change. It integrates with other AWS services like CodeBuild and CodeDeploy, as well as third-party tools, enabling continuous delivery.

AWS CodeBuild is a fully managed continuous integration service that compiles source code, runs tests, and produces ready-to-deploy software packages. It scales continuously and processes multiple builds concurrently, so your builds are never left waiting in a queue.

Amazon SageMaker is a fully managed service that provides every developer and data scientist with the ability to build, train, and deploy machine learning models quickly. It offers built-in algorithms, notebook instances, and model hosting for fast experimentation and scalable production deployments.

Amazon EKS is a managed Kubernetes service that makes it easy to run Kubernetes on AWS without needing to install and operate your own Kubernetes control plane or nodes. EKS is certified Kubernetes conformant and integrates with many AWS services for networking, scalability, and security.

Amazon ECS is a fully managed container orchestration service that supports Docker containers and allows you to easily run and scale containerized applications. You can use it with AWS Fargate for serverless compute or manage your own EC2 instances for more control.

Amazon Glacier is a secure, durable, and extremely low-cost storage service for data archiving and long-term backup. It is optimized for data that is infrequently accessed and supports options for expedited, standard, and bulk retrievals.
